Package com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller

Class IosAppVersionQueryController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller.IosAppVersionQueryController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/apps")
public class IosAppVersionQueryController
extends java.lang.Object
IosAppVersionQueryController is the class containing all API endpoints for quering ios application versions in the mHealthAtlas system.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Integer defaultPage
    Default page is 0
    private java.lang.Integer defaultPageSize
    Default page size is Integer.MAX_VALUE; this default should be changed before going in production
    private java.lang.String defaultSortColumn
    Default sort column is id
    private java.lang.String defaultSortDir
    Default sort direction is ascending

    Queries the application service database by the provided ios application id.

  • Method Details

    • getIosAppVersionsByMHealthAtlasAppId

      @GetMapping("/{id}/ios") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AppVersionInfosDto> getIosAppVersionsByMHealthAtlasAppId​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestParam(value="page",required=false) java.lang.Integer page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=false) java.lang.Integer size, @RequestParam(value="sortDir",required=false) java.lang.String sortDir, @RequestParam(value="sort",required=false) java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the application service database by the provided mHealthAtlas application id.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/{id}/ios

      The amount of returned application version can be restricted using the size parameter. In conjunction with the page parameter application versions can be skipped. The amount of skipped application versions are calculated with the formula: page * size. Additionally the matching application version can be sorted using the sort parameter to specify the sort column and the sortDir parameter to specify the sort direction.

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the mHealthAtlas application id; not null; request path parameter
      page - the starting page number of the returned ios application versions; default is defaultPage; optional query parameter
      size - the page size; default is defaultPageSize; optional query parameter
      sortDir - the sort direction ("ASC", "DESC"); default is defaultSortDir; optional query parameter
      sort - the sort column; default is defaultSortColumn; optional query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched ios application versions if an mHealthAtlas application with the id exists;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR response if the sort column does not exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • getIosAppVersions

      @GetMapping("/ios/{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AppVersionInfosDto> getIosAppVersions​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestParam(value="page",required=false) java.lang.Integer page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=false) java.lang.Integer size, @RequestParam(value="sortDir",required=false) java.lang.String sortDir, @RequestParam(value="sort",required=false) java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the application service database by the provided ios application id.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/ios/{id}

      The amount of returned application version can be restricted using the size parameter. In conjunction with the page parameter application versions can be skipped. The amount of skipped application versions are calculated with the formula: page * size. Additionally the matching application version can be sorted using the sort parameter to specify the sort column and the sortDir parameter to specify the sort direction.

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the ios application id; not null; request path parameter
      page - the starting page number of the returned ios application versions; default is defaultPage; optional query parameter
      size - the page size; default is defaultPageSize; optional query parameter
      sortDir - the sort direction ("ASC", "DESC"); default is defaultSortDir; optional query parameter
      sort - the sort column; default is defaultSortColumn; optional query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched ios application versions if an ios application with the id exists;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR response if the sort column does not exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • getNewestIosAppVersionByMHealthAtlasAppId

      @GetMapping("/{id}/ios/newest") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<IosAppVersionDetailInfoDto> getNewestIosAppVersionByMHealthAtlasAppId​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Queries the application service database by the provided mHealthAtlas application id.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/{id}/ios/newest

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the mHealthAtlas application id; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the newest ios application version of the matched mHealthAtlas application;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • getNewestIosAppVersion

      @GetMapping("/ios/{id}/newest") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<IosAppVersionDetailInfoDto> getNewestIosAppVersion​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)

    • getIosAppVersionByMHealthAtlasAppId

      @GetMapping("/{id}/ios/versions/{versionId}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<IosAppVersionDetailInfoDto> getIosAppVersionByMHealthAtlasAppId​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @PathVariable java.lang.Long versionId)
      Queries the application service database by the provided mHealthAtlas application id and the ios application version id.

      The method can be invoked with a HTTP GET request calling /apps/{id}/ios/version/{versionId}

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the mHealthAtlas application version id; not null; request path parameter
      versionId - the ios application version id; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the found ios application version if the specified mHealthAtlas application with the specified ios application version exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • getIosAppVersion

      @GetMapping("/ios/versions/{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<IosAppVersionDetailInfoDto> getIosAppVersion​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id)
      Queries the application service database by the provided ios application version id.

      The method can be invoked with a HTTP GET request calling /apps/ios/versions/{id}

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the ios application version id; not null; request path parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the found ios application version if the specified ios application version exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • toAppVersionInfosDto

      private AppVersionInfosDto toAppVersionInfosDto​(java.util.List<IosAppVersion> iosAppVersions, java.lang.Long skipped, java.lang.Long returned, java.lang.Long total)
      Transforms each ios application version to an AppVersionDto using the IosAppVersionExtensions.toAppVersionDto method. The transformed ios application versions are wrapped in an AppVersionInfosDto.
      Parameters:
      iosAppVersions - the List of ios application versions
      skipped - the skipped ios application versions
      returned - the returned ios application versions number
      total - the total number of ios application versions in the database
      Returns:
      AppVersionInfosDto, a application version infos wrapper object
      See Also:
      IosAppVersionExtensions.toAppVersionDto(IosAppVersion)
